The Coway AP-1512HH air purifier may not look as nice or have as many connectivity options as some of its competitors, but its solid performance more than makes up for its lack of flash.


Pros

+ User-friendly

+ great performance

+ Reset Indicator for filters

+ ECO Mode

+ Auto/eco modes

+ Strong Motor

+ Good Airflow

+ Energy-efficient


Cons

- Filters are expensive

- sound on the higher side on full power

- heavy


Read on for a full breakdown of the Coway AP-1512HH, including its specifications, features, pros, cons, and pricing. During this series of tests, we will use an air particle meter to determine how efficiently this air purifier captures and eliminates particles. As a result, you will know how effectively Coway AP-1512HH can function in your house. We will also evaluate the Coway AP-1512HH's design and user interface and any additional features it may have.


Coway Ap1512hh Air Purifier: Key Specs


Size:16.8x18.3x9.6

Weight: 12.3lbs

Filter spec: Pre-filter, Carbon, Hepa

CADR: 247.5/232.3/241.3

Speed: Three speeds, auto, eco

Noise: 36.8/58.3db

Energy Consumption: 0.082 kWh/day

Warranty: Three-year


According to the manufacturer, the GreenHEPATM filter found in the Coway AP-1512HH can remove up to 99.97% of potentially hazardous airborne particles, including cigarette smoke and tiny dust particles. In addition, it has built-in sensors that monitor the air quality even when the purifier is operating and provide a real-time indication of how pure the air is through an air quality detector.

Additionally, the purifier has a pre-filter that captures bigger particles and a deodorization filter that eliminates odors and gases. The Coway AP-1512HH has a competitive price, which places it in the middle of the industry's offerings. If you are searching for an inexpensive purifier for a house with several large rooms, this one is a decent option.

And if you decide it's not the ideal model for you, this review of the finest air purifiers has a wide variety of other affordable and high-end solutions.



Small in scale but big on performance, this Coway AP-1512HH more than compensates for its slight build with its robust fan and solid functionality. Despite its unconventional appearance, this air purifier is just what your home needs if you're concerned about the health of its occupants and the environment.

That's why we count it among the best air purifiers available. The robust performance of this portable air cleaner belies its low cost. It may not be the smoothest machine, but it will do your job well.


COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER: DESIGN


Its charming appearance complements the fun sounds it makes. The device has a pleasant chime that plays whenever it is on to reassure the user that it is operational. The gadget produces additional sounds at other times, such as when the front latch is closed, or the power is off. The device's upbeat sounds are, oddly enough, somewhat reassuring.


The Coway AP-1512HH weighs just 12.3 pounds, so you can easily pick it up and transport it from room to room using the built-in handle. An electrical cord that is 6 feet long provides sufficient wiggle room for use in most locations.



The component is manufactured from white plastic and has the form of a square box with a low profile. The front of the device has a spherical dome with a shallow center encased in a grey plastic frame. The crown appears to be translucent, which raises the possibility that it contains lighting or has some other purpose.


You can purchase the air purifier in either white or black color. At first sight, it appears to be missing a few of the visual flourishes in other air purifiers' models. However, because it has such a simple form, it can almost disappear entirely into the space's backdrop. The interface is easy to use and understand because of its minimalistic design.


On the other hand, it might well be a deliberate design choice. One customer on Amazon observed that the Coway air purifier appears to be fashioned in the same manner as the world's most giant iPod Nano, assuming you are familiar with such a thing.


COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER: PERFORMANCE


Our at-home testing was in a 220 sq ft area. We assessed the ambient air quality before and after using the purifier, in addition to conducting a match smoke test and an altar smoke test. All experiments lasted 30 minutes so we could analyze how fast the air purifier removed air pollutants.


First, we used the loudest setting below 50 decibels. Level 2 is the second highest. It was 42 decibels, like a library. We next repeated the same tests at level 3, 57 dB louder.


When tested at level 2 fan speed, the Coway AP-1512HH was able to catch 72.4% of spherical nanoparticles than particles with a diameter of 0.3 microns and 72.7% of particles less than 2.5 microns to use a particle velocity counter beforehand, throughout, and following the experiment. At high fan speed, the purifier removed 89.9% of 0.3-micron particles and 92.8 of 2.5-micron particles.


It also had the lowest energy consumption of the models we evaluated, so it was incredibly efficient. This air purifier conserves a significant amount of energy compared to others we've tested, drawing onlyâ€”08 kWh in an automatic mode for more than a 24-hour period. One of the reasons it gets considered among the greatest is that it efficiently handles energy and contaminants.



A matching test followed after lighting a string of matches one after another to increase the particle concentration in the space significantly. We put the air purifier through its paces on levels 2 and 3 to evaluate how well it performed.


Based on these results, we anticipated that level 3 would completely blow it out of the water. The Coway AP-1512HH eliminated 99.7% of 0.3-micron particles, 97.2% of 2.5-micron particles, and 100% of 10-micron particles.


COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER: USABILITY


Before using the Coway AP-1512HH for the first time, its configuration can accomplish in a manner that is not overly complicated. Click the front of the air purifier back onto its base, remove two of its three filters in the plastic wrappings, and then reinstall them correctly. After that, you may replace the purifier's front panel. After that, you need to connect the device and turn it on.


You can set the sensor's sensitivity at one of three levels using the Coway AP-1512HH's adjustable sensitivity settings. You have the alternative of selecting sensitive, standard, or insensitive as your preference. The names themselves give away the degree of sensitivity involved. The sensor will evaluate the gadget's environment, precisely the air quality.



The Coway AP-1512HH requires very little in the way of assembly right out of the box. You will need to open the front flap, detach the strips that keep the pre-filter in place, and then open the plastic bags containing the coal or HEPA filters behind the pre-filter. Just remember to put things back in the same sequence that you took them out, or else nothing will fit.


The handbook is also helpful since it provides just the correct information for setting up and diagnosing problems. You won't have trouble figuring out how to utilize the controls, and the beeping will provide you with a clear indicator of how it responds. If you need to hide it from view, you shouldn't have any trouble doing so because it is compact and straightforward to assemble.


COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER: PRICE


Despite being more affordable, this space-saving air purifier delivers a powerful punch, as you will find when you read our review of the Coway Airmega AP-1512HH. And even though it may not be the most silent of operators, you can count on it to get the work completed.


The Coway Air Purifier has a suggested retail price of $229, but if you grab it while it's on sale, you can purchase it for less than $200. It is possible to acquire it by direct purchase from various merchants, such as Walmart, Amazon, Bed Bath &' Beyond, and Coway. A white model and a black model of this air purifier are available to purchase.



The suggested retail price for filter replacements is $57, which is quite pricey; however, you can purchase them on Amazon for as low as $35 when they are on sale.


COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER: USER REVIEWS


The Coway AP-1512HH has received 4.5 stars out of 5 on Amazon, reflecting its high satisfaction level with thousands of buyers. More than 80 percent of consumers rate it as perfect five stars. They have nothing but praise for the effectiveness of the air purifier in eliminating unpleasant scents, as well as for how quietly it operates when set to its lowest fan speed. Many people are astounded by how wonderfully the automatic mode of the Coway AP-1512HH works, namely how it jumps into activity if an animal has an accident or if someone toasts their bread too long.


However, several unfavorable reviews remind us that the third level, which is the highest possible setting, is just too loud and makes a significant volume increase from level 2. Some people believe that lights should not be used in a bedroom at night because of how bright they are. On the Coway website, some customers have voiced dissatisfaction with the difficulty of acquiring replacement filters and the high cost of purchasing them through Amazon.


SHOULD YOU BUY THE COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER?


The Coway Air purifier is a good choice if you are looking for an air purifier with a price point somewhere in the middle that delivers a powerful and efficient function in a household with large rooms. This machine is a powerful workhouse that gets the job done without many extra bells and whistles.


This air purifier has received positive customer reviews, with many applauding its ability to identify and eliminate unpleasant odors in almost no time. However, it is not the most aesthetically pleasing air purifier currently for sale, and it cannot be quiet when turned up to its highest setting. People who like to keep their homes filled with innovative and linked devices might think it's too simple.


In general, the Coway AP-1512HH is a cute small air purifier that does a good job. If you can overlook the fact that it seems strange to look at and makes more noise than you'd anticipate, then it's a product worth investing in.


It does not have the same potency as more giant air purifiers, such as the HealthProtect 7470i from Blueair, but it does function better than the smaller devices, for instance, the Levoit 300. You won't find an air purifier that is more adorable, useful, or practical than this one, especially considering the price. Assuming you don't mind the look that Apple favors.


HOW WE TESTED THE COWAY AP1512HH AIR PURIFIER?


We had long wanted to try out the Coway Airmega AP-1512HH. We have found the Coway AP to be effective and easy to use. In certain areas, it exceeds expectations slightly. The Coway AP-1512HH performed exceptionally well across the board of evaluations.


We conducted a series of tests, including a match smoke test and an altar smoke test, to determine how much of an improvement there was in air quality before and after using the purifier. Each trial lasted 30 minutes to gauge the efficiency with which the air purifier could collect and eliminate airborne contaminants.


It performed our initial tests at the maximum volume level that registered at less than 50 dB. That was the second-highest possible setting, level 2. It operated roughly equivalent to a quiet library, 42 dB. Next, we repeated the tests using the more robust but distracting level 3 setting (57 dB of noise).


The next phase was the scrimmage. We tested the purifier's effectiveness on levels 2 and 3 after repeatedly burning matches by increasing the particulate count in the environment.
